body.raw:
# ðŸ The Dawn of Speed: A New Century, A New World of Racing

_As featured in the March 1900 Edition of the WSMC Journal_

As Europe marches confidently into the new century, a mechanical revolution is taking hold of the continentâ€”and the world. Gone are the days when horsepower referred solely to animals. In its place: fire, oil, and speed.

The **World Motorsport Championship**, an ambitious project bringing together eleven of the globeâ€™s most daring manufacturers and twenty-two of its boldest drivers, prepares to launch its inaugural campaign. Ten Grand Prix. One champion. Eternal glory.

---

## ðŸŒ The Calendar: From Roman Cobblestones to American Steel

The season begins under the looming shadows of ancient ruins at the **Roman Grand Prix**, where elevation changes, narrow avenues, and unpredictable terrain promise chaos from the start. From there, the grid storms through:

- ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡· *Paris GP* (Le Mans) and *French GP* (Clermont-Ferrand) â€” twin titans of French engineering pride.
- ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡­ *Swiss GP* (Bern) â€” a tactical and altitude-testing ordeal.
- ðŸ‡­ðŸ‡º *Austro-Hungarian GP* (Budapest) â€” where roads are wide, but politics are fragile.
- ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡¹ *Italian GP* (Turin) â€” the homeland battle for Fiat and Isotta Fraschini.
- ðŸ‡©ðŸ‡ª *German GP* and *Rhineland GP* â€” high-speed duels on disciplined roads.
- ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ *Chicago GP* and *New York GP* â€” the bold American finale in a land still earning its racing credentials.

---

## ðŸ”© Constructors: Kings, Upstarts, and Outsiders

The paddock divides into **three tribes**: the *Established Powers*, the *Flashy Contenders*, and the *Dangerous Unknowns*.

### ðŸ‘‘ The Front Runners
- **Renault** (Rating: 10): The class of the field. Veteran lineup. Iron discipline.
- **Mercedes** (8): A pair of killersâ€”**Jenatzy** and **Szisz**â€”with a silver bullet machine.
- **De Dion-Bouton** (8): **HÃ©mery** and **Fournier** may be the best 1â€“2 punch in the sport.

### ðŸŽ¨ The Eye Catchers
- **Peugeot** (7): Their *pink and white* livery has raised eyebrows, but so has their raw pace.
- **Opel** (6): Neon purple and wild ambition. **Lautenschlager** is the youngest driver on the grid.
- **Isotta Fraschini** (5): Led by the aging but fiery **Alessandro Cutillo**, their strategy is all risk.

### âš ï¸ The Question Marks
- **Oldsmobile** (5): **Ripper** and **Sturtz** bring brute force. Will it be enough in Europe?
- **Minerva** (5): A globe-trotting underdog team. Veteran **Zion Maize** could surprise.
- **Napier** (6): British elegance and calmâ€”maybe too calm for this grid.

---

## ðŸ§‘â€âœˆï¸ Drivers to Watch

- **Victor HÃ©mery (De Dion-Bouton)** â€” blistering in testing, a title favorite.
- **Camille Jenatzy (Mercedes)** â€” unpredictable, aggressive, and terrifyingly fast.
- **Barney Oldfield (Peugeot)** â€” the American phenom brings charisma and chaos.
- **Fernand Charron (Renault)** â€” the thinking manâ€™s racer, perfect for the long game.

---

## ðŸ—žï¸ Headlines in the Paddock

> â€œAll of France is watching Renault and De Dion-Bouton... and all of France is terrified of being embarrassed.â€ â€” *Lâ€™Ã‰cho de lâ€™Automobile*

> â€œOldfield says heâ€™ll win or crash trying in Rome. He may do both.â€ â€” *The New York Daily Record*

> â€œYouâ€™d be mad not to bet on Mercedes. But everyoneâ€™s mad in this sport.â€ â€” *La Gazzetta della VelocitÃ *

---

## ðŸ”® Predictions & Politics

Renault is the favoriteâ€”on paper. But *paper burns*, and so too might the fuse of this young championship. Expect:

- Mechanical retirements aplenty  
- Intra-team rivalries (keep an eye on Fiatâ€™s garage)  
- A French-German arms race, on wheels  
- At least one American podium before seasonâ€™s end  
- And the first WSMC Champion crowned on the streets of New York

---

## ðŸ The Stage Is Set

On March 25, 1900, the world will watch Rome. Engines will roar where once gladiators fought. And at the end of it all, a new kind of warrior will be bornâ€”the **World Motorsport Champion**.

Let the race begin.
